text.p: Daiwa Europe Limited has given Polish engineering and construction company Prochem SA a buy rating, saying the firm's current and prospective price- earnings ratios were undemanding in its sector, Daiwa said.
"The valuation of 14 times historic and 8.5 times prospective is undemanding in the high-growth construction sector," Daiwa said in a report dated March 3.
"We believe Prochem, because it is a small and specialised company, and because it is not involved in the high-profile roadbuilding programme, has been overlooked," it added.

Daiwa said Prochem should benefit from the privatisation of the chemicals, pharmaceuticals and petrochemicals sectors in Poland and that demand would increase due to EU compliant processes, environmental requirements and quality needs.
Daiwa saw Prochem lifting net profit to 5.4 million zlotys this year and 6.7 million next year from 3.4 million in 1996.
Its price-earnings ratio for 1998 would shrink to 7.2, with earnings per share rising to 1.10 zlotys this year and 1.30 zlotys next year from 0.67 zlotys in 1996.
